author: .paulharris
content:
We can mark the GET deprecated so that people know, and theres been no firm point to remove previously, last time i just got annoyed having deprecated endpoints for so long, and removed them...
It was something like 6-12months, and the endpoints were literally no longer usable (relied on phase0) so it was a bit of a no brainer....
If they're not 'validator required', theres no reason why a team may decide their own timeframe, but hopefully everyone is fair on that. Deleting straight away because they're deprecated now would be a bad outcome.

author: .paulharris
content:
GET Block is a great example of removing phase0 means no longer being able to get access to data thats part of the chain near genesis.... Some nodes still allow fetching of that data, and I think that is probably 'fair' in the spirit of being able to historically look at the entire chain if you so choose..
The new block functions only support from a certain point, for a fair reason. Anything 'validator required' kind of comes into that area where all types can't always be supported...
These two examples alone kind of show why I don't think we need a hard and fast rule, we just need to be aware.
I know all the test nets etc are 'current', not sure if people create private networks often? I've seen a couple float about, I'm not sure what they do in terms of choosing what hard fork they're running etc...
I'm not sure why anyone would want to run an altair private network (other than testing maybe, and dev...) but there's no real rules saying that you can't...
